title: [Bug] Edit note & Replay audio buttons inconsistently appear based on initial screen rotation
body:
###### Reproduction Steps

1. Click on a deck to study the cards while the device is portrait
2. Note the `Edit note` and `Replay audio` buttons are not in the top right
3. Rotate the device horizontally and note that the `Edit note` and `Replay audio` buttons are still not there
4. Back out to Decks screen
5. Click on a deck to study the cards while the device is horizontal
6. Note the `Edit note` and `Replay audio` buttons are now in the top right (even for cards without audio)
7. Rotate the device to portrait and note that the `Edit note` and `Replay audio` buttons are still there (even for cards without audio)


###### Expected Result
1. The visibility of overflow buttons should be consistent regardless of initial device orientation when selecting a deck
2. Optionally, the replay audio button should not appear on cards with no audio (perhaps this should be a separate issue)
3. Optionally, the replay audio button appears to be redundant given there's already a play audio button next to the word itself. Although, this could be considered by design and falls under [removing the audio play button](https://github.com/ankidroid/Anki-Android/wiki/Advanced-formatting#remove-the-audio-play-button-from-flashcards) in the FAQ.


###### Actual Result
Buttons tagged to show `ifRoom` show up when a deck has been clicked on while the device is horizontal and remain there until backed out. This means the user could be studying a card horizontally, but depending on their device orientation when they initially clicked on a card, the buttons may or may not be there.
